COOKIE_CONSENT.MESSAGE: This website uses cookies to ensure the best user experience possible.

TITLE.HOME: Logigator - Build and Simulate Logic Circuits

INTRO.DESCRIPTION: Build, simulate and manage complex logic circuits for free.

FEATURES.TITLE: Features
FEATURES.DESCRIPTION: Build and simulate your own circuits with Logigator, a simple yet powerful online tool.
FEATURES.PERFORMANCE_DES: Logigators' editor can handle even the largest projects with ease thanks to WebAssembly and WebGL.
FEATURES.SUBCIRCUITS_DES: Create subcircuits and use them all over your projects to help keep them organized.
FEATURES.SHARE_DES: Share your circuits with other users, so they can learn from your work.
FEATURES.IMAGES_DES: With Logigator you can export high resolution images in three different formats (SVG, PNG, JPG) to use them anywhere.

EXAMPLES.TITLE: Example Circuits
EXAMPLES.DESCRIPTION: Learn to design simple and more complex circuits from our examples.

VIDEO.TITLE: What are logic circuits?
VIDEO.DESCRIPTION: If you don't know what logic gates or logic circuits are, we animated a short explanation for you to watch.

SHARES.PROJECTS_DESCRIPTION: Explore other projects created by our community. Your Project could be the next on this list.
SHARES.COMPS_DESCRIPTION: Explore other components created by our community. They may be useful for you.

WHAT_IS.TITLE: What is Logigator
WHAT_IS.TEXT:
Logigator is an online simulator for logic gates which enables the user to build and simulate circuits with logic gates. For example, one can build half-adders and full-adders which can be used for learning. Whether one wants to experiment and explore boolean functions or design new and complex circuits - Logigator is the right tool.
In addition, Logigator offers high performance even with large-scale projects. By using “WebAssembly” (https://webassembly.org/), the website can reach simulation speeds that would not be possible in a browser otherwise.

GENERAL.TITLE: General
GENERAL.TEXT:
The editor can be reached under https://logigator.com/editor and can be used to design and simulate circuits.
To place an element, simply select the wanted element from the construction-kit on the left side of the window. The basic gates consist of: AND, OR, XOR, NOT as well as a delay which doesn't change the input signal and a clock, which outputs a signal in periodical intervals. Naturally, there are also more complex elements which are not mentioned here. After one selects an element, it can be placed by clicking anywhere in the canvas. Using the selection-tool one can select an element and change settings in the box in the bottom right corner. These settings vary from component to component. The wire-tool can then be used to connect the elements.

CUSTOM_COMPS.TITLE: Custom Components
CUSTOM_COMPS.TEXT:
One might want to use a part of a circuit multiple times. To simplify this process it is possible to define custom components, which can easily be placed multiple times and can even be used in other projects.
There are two types of plug components: inputs and outputs. By placing these components one can mark the inputs and outputs of a custom components. Additionally parts of circuits can be labeled for better overview.

SIMULATION.TITLE: Simulation Mode
SIMULATION.TEXT: The simulation-mode can be used to test and simulate circuits. To switch to simulation mode, simply press the “Start Simulation” button. To start the simulation simply press the play button. Now you can interact with the circuit. In case you want to see what the circuit is doing, you can pause the simulation and test it step by step. To return to the original state simply press the stop button. By default the simulation will run as fast as possible. However, the clock speed can be changed by simply entering the wanted speed or locking it to the display's frequency. The composition of custom components can be observed by simply clicking on them.

SAVING.TITLE: Saving Projects
SAVING.TEXT: Projects and Components can either be saved locally as a file or in the cloud, which enables editing on multiple devices. To save projects online the user has to be logged in, which also enables projects to be shared with other users.

PRIVACY_POLICY:
Privacy Policy

Data protection

We have written this data protection declaration (version 11.11.2019-211106637) in order to be able to offer you in accordance with the requirements of General Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 and the Data Protection Act (DSG) to explain what information we collect, how we use data and which As a visitor to this website, you have choices.

Unfortunately, it is in the nature of things that these explanations sound very technical. We met with the However, creation tries to describe the most important things as simply and clearly as possible.

Automatic data storage

When you visit websites these days, certain information is automatically created and stored, like this also on this website.

If you visit our website as you are now, our web server (computer on which this website is saved) automatically data such as

  • the address (URL) of the accessed website
  • Browser and browser version
  • the operating system used
  • the address (URL) of the previously visited page (referrer URL)
  • the host name and the IP address of the device from which access is made
  • Date and time

in files (web server log files).

As a rule, web server log files are stored for two weeks and then automatically deleted. We give this Data no further, however, cannot rule out the possibility that this data is unlawful Behavior can be viewed.

Storage of personal data

Personal data that you transmit to us electronically on this website, such as name, E-mail address, address or other personal information in the context of submitting a form or Comments in the blog, together with the time and the IP address, will only be given by us Purpose used, kept safe and not passed on to third parties.

We therefore only use your personal data for communication with those visitors who have expressly contacted you and for the processing of the services and products offered on this website. We give Your personal data will not be passed on without your consent, but we cannot rule out the possibility that this data will be available during Unlawful behavior can be viewed.

If you send us personal data by e-mail - outside of this website - we cannot be sure of it Guaranteeing the transmission and protection of your data. We recommend that you never keep confidential data to be sent unencrypted by e-mail.

Rights according to the General Data Protection Regulation

According to the provisions of the GDPR and the Austrian Data Protection Act (DSG) basically the following rights:

  • Right to rectification (Article 16 GDPR)
  • Right to erasure ("right to be forgotten") (Article 17 GDPR)
  • Right to restriction of processing (Article 18 GDPR)
  • Right to notification - obligation to notify in connection with the Correction or deletion of personal data or the restriction of processing (Article 19 GDPR)
  • Right to data portability (Article 20 GDPR)
  • Right of objection (Article 21 GDPR)
  • Right, not one exclusively on automated processing - including profiling - based decision to be subjected (Article 22 GDPR)

If you believe that the processing of your data violates data protection law or yours Data protection claims have otherwise been violated in any way, you can contact the Complain to the supervisory authority, which is the data protection authority in Austria whose website you can find under https://www.dsb.gv.at/ find.

Evaluation of visitor behavior

In the following data protection declaration, we inform you whether and how we use data from your visit to this Evaluate website. The data collected is usually evaluated anonymously and we can use your Behavior on this website does not identify you as a person.

You can find out more about the possibilities to object to this analysis of the visit data in the following Privacy Policy.

TLS encryption with https

We use https to transfer data securely on the Internet (data protection through technology design Article 25 Paragraph 1 GDPR ). Through the use of TLS (Transport Layer Security), an encryption protocol for secure data transmission on the Internet we ensure the protection of confidential data. You recognize the use of this protection of the Data transfer at the small lock symbol in the top left of the browser and the use of the https scheme (instead of http) as part of our internet address.

Google reCAPTCHA privacy policy

Our primary goal is to ensure that our website is as protected and secure as possible for you and for us. To that We use Google reCAPTCHA from Google Inc. (1600 Amphitheater Parkway Mountain View, CA 94043, USA). With reCAPTCHA we can determine whether you are really a person made of flesh and blood and not a robot or any other spam software. By spam we mean any, electronically, unwanted information that comes to us unsolicited. With the classic CAPTCHAS you had to go to Review mostly solve text or picture puzzles. With reCAPTCHA from Google, we usually don't have to deal with them Pester puzzles. In most cases it is sufficient to simply tick the box and confirm that that you are not a bot. With the new Invisible reCAPTCHA version you don't even have to check the box anymore. In the course of this you will learn exactly how this works and, above all, which data is used for it Privacy Policy.

What is reCAPTCHA?

reCAPTCHA is a free captcha service from Google that protects websites from spam software and misuse protects non-human visitors. Most often this service is used when using forms on the internet to complete. A captcha service is an automatic Turing test that is designed to ensure that an action is in the Internet is made by a human, not a bot. In the classic Turing test (named after the computer scientist Alan Turing) a human discovers the distinction between bot and human. With captchas This is also done by the computer or a software program. Classic captchas work with small tasks, which are easy to solve for humans, but have considerable difficulties for machines. At reCAPTCHA you no longer have to actively solve puzzles. The tool uses modern risk techniques to keep people from bots distinguish. Here you only have to tick the text field "I am not a robot" or in the Invisible field reCAPTCHA even that is no longer necessary. With reCAPTCHA, a JavaScript element is included in the source code integrated and then the tool runs in the background and analyzes your user behavior. From these user actions the software calculates a so-called captcha score. Google uses this score to calculate before the Captcha input of the probability that you are human. ReCAPTCHA or Captchas in In general, bots are always used when certain actions (such as registrations, surveys, etc.) manipulate or abuse.

Why do we use reCAPTCHA on our website?

We only want to welcome people of flesh and blood to our side. Bots or spam software of all kinds can stay at home with confidence. That is why we are pulling out all the stops to protect ourselves and to offer you the best possible usability. This is why we use Google reCAPTCHA the company Google. So we can be pretty sure that we will remain a “bot-free” website. Through the When using reCAPTCHA, data is transmitted to Google, which Google uses to determine whether you are too are really human. reCAPTCHA therefore serves the security of our website and consequently also Your safety. For example, without reCAPTCHA it could happen that a bot Registered as many e-mail addresses as possible in order to follow up forums or blogs with unsolicited advertising content "Zuzuspamen". With reCAPTCHA we can avoid such bot attacks.

Which data is saved by reCAPTCHA?

ReCAPTCHA collects personal data from users in order to determine whether the actions on our website also occur really come from humans. So it can be the IP address and other data that Google uses for the reCAPTCHA service needs to be sent to Google. IP addresses are used within the member states of the EU or others Contracting states to the Agreement on the European Economic Area almost always shortened before the data end up on a server in the USA. The IP address is not combined with other data from Google, provided that You are not signed in to your Google account while using reCAPTCHA. First he checks reCAPTCHA algorithm, whether Google cookies from other Google services (YouTube. Gmail etc.) are placed. ReCAPTCHA then sets an additional cookie in your browser and records one Snapshot of your browser window.

The following list of collected browser and user data does not claim to be exhaustive. Much more are examples of data that, to our knowledge, are processed by Google.

  • Referrer URL (the address of the page from which the visitor comes)
  • IP address (e.g. 256.123.123.1)
  • Information about the operating system (the software that runs your computer enables. Known operating systems are Windows, Mac OS X or Linux)
  • Cookies (small text files that save data in your browser)
  • Mouse and keyboard behavior (any action you take with the mouse or keyboard execute is saved)
  • Date and language settings (which language or which date you want on your PC preset will be saved)
  • All Javascript objects (JavaScript is a programming language that makes web pages allows to adapt to the user. JavaScript objects can hold all kinds of data under one name collect)
  • Screen resolution (shows how many pixels are used to display the image consists)

It is undisputed that Google uses and analyzes this data even before you click the “I am not a Robot "click. With the Invisible reCAPTCHA version, even the ticking is omitted and the whole thing The recognition process runs in the background. You can find out exactly how much and what data Google stores from Google not in detail.

The following cookies are used by reCAPTCHA: Here we refer to the reCAPTCHA demo version of Google at https://www.google.com/recaptcha/api2/demo . Alles these cookies require a unique identifier for tracking purposes. Here is a list of cookies that Google uses reCAPTCHA has set on the demo version:

Expiry time: after one year

In this way, advertising effectiveness can be measured and appropriate optimization measures can be taken. IDE is stored in browsers under the domain doubleclick.net.

Note: This list cannot claim to be complete, as experience has shown that Google is the choice of your cookies also changed again and again.

How long and where will the data be stored?

By inserting reCAPTCHA, your data will be transferred to the Google server. Where exactly this data are saved, Google does not show clearly, even after repeated inquiries. Without a confirmation from Google, it can be assumed that data such as mouse interaction, time spent on the Website or language settings are stored on the European or American Google servers. The IP address that your browser transmits to Google is generally not used with other Google data merged with other Google services. However, if you are using the reCAPTCHA plug-in at If you are logged into your Google account, the data will be merged. The different data protection regulations of Google apply.

How can I delete my data or prevent data storage?

If you do not want any data about you or your behavior to be transmitted to Google, you must Before you visit our website or use the reCAPTCHA software, log out of Google completely and delete all Google cookies. In principle, the data is automatically sent as soon as you visit our website Google transmitted. In order to delete this data again, you must contact Google support https://support.google.com/?hl=de&tid=211106637 .

So, by using our website, you are consenting to Google LLC and its agents automatically collect, process and use data.

You can learn a little more about reCAPTCHA on the Google web developer page at https://developers.google.com/recaptcha/ . Google goes into the technical development of the reCAPTCHA in more detail, but provides detailed information about Data storage and data protection-related topics are also not available there. A good overview of the The basic use of data by Google can be found in the in-house data protection declaration on https://www.google.com/intl/de/policies/privacy/ .

Google Analytics data protection declaration

Pseudonymization

Our concern within the meaning of the GDPR is the improvement of our offer and our website. Since the The privacy of our users is important, the user data is pseudonymized. The data processing takes place on the basis of the legal provisions of Section 96 Paragraph 3 TKG and Art 6 EU GDPR Paragraph 1 lit a (consent) and / or f (legitimate interest) of the GDPR.

Deactivation of data collection by Google Analytics

Using the browser add-on for deactivation from Google Analytics JavaScript (ga.js, analytics.js, dc.js) can prevent website visitors from using Google Analytics Data used.

You can record the data generated by the cookie and related to your use of the website Prevent Google and the processing of this data by Google by clicking on the link below Download and install the available browser plug-in: https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout?hl=de

Google Analytics IP anonymization

We have implemented the IP address anonymization of Google Analytics on this website. this function was developed by Google so that this website complies with the applicable data protection regulations and recommendations of local data protection authorities can comply if they prohibit the storage of the full IP address. The anonymization or masking of the IP takes place as soon as the IP addresses are in Google Analytics data collection network arrive and before any storage or processing of the data takes place.

You can find more information on IP anonymization at https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/2763052?hl=de .

Google Analytics reports on demographics and interests

We have switched on the functions for advertising reports in Google Analytics. The reports on demographic Characteristics and interests contain information on age, gender and interests. So we can - without to be able to assign this data to individual persons - get a better picture of our users More about the You can find out about advertising functions on https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/3450482?hl=de_AT&utm_id=ad .

You can control the use of the activities and information of your Google account under “Settings for advertising” on https://adssettings.google.com/authenticated with a checkbox.

YouTube privacy policy

We have installed YouTube videos on our website. So we can send you interesting videos directly present on our site. YouTube is a video portal that has been a subsidiary of Google LLC since 2006. The video portal is operated by YouTube, LLC, 901 Cherry Ave., San Bruno, CA 94066, USA. If you on If you call up a page on our website that has embedded a YouTube video, your browser will connect automatically with the servers of YouTube or Google. Different data are used (depending on the settings) transfer. Google is responsible for all data processing and data protection therefore also applies from Google.

In the following we would like to explain to you in more detail which data is processed and why we use YouTube videos and how you can manage or delete your data.

What is YouTube?

On YouTube, users can watch, rate, comment and upload videos for free. About the In the last few years, YouTube has become one of the most important social media channels in the world. So that we have videos on our Website, YouTube provides a code excerpt that we have incorporated on our site have.

Why do we use YouTube videos on our website?

YouTube is the video platform with the most visitors and the best content. We strive to offer you the To offer the best possible user experience on our website. And of course, interesting videos are not allowed absence. With the help of our embedded videos, we provide you with additional texts and images helpful content available. In addition, our website is displayed on the Google search engine by the embedded videos more easily found. Even if we place advertisements through Google Ads, Google can - thanks of the data collected - these ads really only show people who are interested in our offers interested.

What data is stored by YouTube?

As soon as you visit one of our pages that has a YouTube video integrated, YouTube sets at least one cookie, which stores your IP address and our URL. If you are logged into your YouTube account, YouTube can use your Allocate interactions on our website to your profile using cookies. This includes data such as Session duration, bounce rate, approximate location, technical information such as browser type, screen resolution or your internet provider. Further data can include contact details, any reviews, content sharing via Social media or adding it to your favorites on YouTube.

If you are not signed in to a Google account or a Youtube account, Google will save data with a unique identifier associated with your device, browser or app. For example, your keep preferred language setting. But a lot of interaction data cannot be saved because fewer cookies are set.

In the following list we show cookies that were set in a test in the browser. We show on the one hand Cookies that are set without a registered YouTube account. On the other hand, we show cookies with registered account. The list cannot claim to be complete because the user data always depend on the interactions on YouTube.

How long and where will the data be stored?

The data that YouTube receives and processes from you is stored on the Google servers. Most these servers are located in America. Under https://www.google.com/about/datacenters/inside/locations/?hl=de see exactly where the Google data centers are located. Your data is distributed on the servers. So are the data can be accessed more quickly and better protected against manipulation.

Google stores the collected data for different lengths of time. You can delete some data at any time, others are automatically deleted after a limited time and others are deleted by Google over a longer period of time saved. Some data (such as items from "My Activity", photos or documents, products) that are stored in your Google account are saved until you delete them. Even if you're not in one If you are signed in to a Google account, you can use some data that is associated with your device, browser or app delete.

How can I delete my data or prevent data storage?

Basically, you can delete data in the Google account manually. With the automatic Deletion of location and activity data will be information depending on your decision - either Saved for 3 or 18 months and then deleted.

So you can decide for each individual cookie whether you want it allow or not. Since YouTube is a subsidiary of Google, there is a common one Data protection. Cookies

Our website uses HTTP cookies to save user-specific data.
In the following we explain what cookies are and why they are used so that you can use the following Understand the privacy policy better.

What exactly are cookies?

Whenever you surf the Internet, you are using a browser. Well-known browsers are for example Chrome, Safari, Firefox, Internet Explorer and Microsoft Edge. Most websites save small ones Text files in your browser. These files are called cookies.

One thing cannot be dismissed out of hand: Cookies are really useful little helpers. Almost all websites use cookies. More precisely, they are HTTP cookies, as there are other cookies for others Areas of application there. HTTP cookies are small files that our website stores on your computer get saved. These cookie files are automatically stored in the cookie folder, in the "brain" of your browser, housed. A cookie consists of a name and a value. When defining a cookie you must one or more attributes can also be specified.

Cookies store certain user data from you, such as language or personal page settings. When you visit our site again, your browser transmits the "user-related" information to our site back. Thanks to cookies, our website knows who you are and offers you the settings that you are used to are. In some browsers each cookie has its own file, in others such as Firefox all cookies are saved in a single file.

There are both first-party cookies and third-party cookies. First party cookies are used directly by created on our site, third-party cookies are used by partner websites (e.g. Google Analytics) created. Each cookie must be evaluated individually, as each cookie stores different data. Also the expiration time a cookie varies from a few minutes to a few years. Cookies are not software programs and do not contain viruses, Trojans or other "pests". Cookies cannot access your information either PCs access.

This is how cookie data can look like:

Name: _ga
Value: GA1.2.1326744211.152211106637 Purpose: Differentiation of website visitors
Expiry date: after 2 years

These minimum sizes should be supported by a browser:

  • At least 4096 bytes per cookie
  • At least 50 cookies per domain
  • At least 3000 cookies in total

What types of cookies are there?

The question of which cookies we specifically use depends on the services used and is addressed in the clarified in the following sections of the data protection declaration. At this point we would like to briefly look at the various Types of HTTP cookies received.

There are 4 types of cookies:

Essential cookies
 These cookies are necessary to ensure the basic functions of the website. For example needs these cookies, when a user puts a product in the shopping cart, then continues to surf on other pages and goes to the checkout later. These cookies do not delete the shopping cart, even if it is the user Browser window closes.

Appropriate cookies
 These cookies collect information about user behavior and whether the user receives any error messages. In addition, these cookies are also used to determine the loading time and behavior of the website in different browsers measured.

Targeted cookies
 These cookies ensure better user-friendliness. For example, entered Locations, font sizes or form data saved.

advertising cookies
 These cookies are also called targeting cookies. They serve the user individually adapted To deliver advertising. That can be very practical, but also very annoying.

Usually when you visit a website for the first time you will be asked which of these types of cookies you allow would like. And of course this decision is also saved in a cookie.

How can I delete cookies?

You decide how and whether you want to use cookies. Regardless of which service or which one Website from which cookies originate, you always have the option of deleting, deactivating or just deactivating cookies partially allow. For example, you can block third-party cookies, but all other cookies allow.

If you want to find out which cookies have been stored in your browser when you change cookie settings change or delete, you can find this in your browser settings:

Chrome: Delete, activate and manage cookies in Chrome

Safari: manage cookies and website data with Safari

Firefox: Delete cookies to remove data that is on your websites Computer

Internet Explorer: deleting and managing cookies

Microsoft Edge: deleting and managing cookies

If you generally do not want cookies, you can set up your browser so that it always accepts you informs when a cookie is to be set. So you can decide for each individual cookie whether you allow the cookie or not. The procedure is different depending on the browser. The best thing to do is look for them Instructions in Google with the search term “delete cookies Chrome” or “deactivate cookies Chrome” in the case a Chrome browser.

How about my data protection?

The so-called "cookie guidelines" have existed since 2009. It states that the storage of cookies consent required from you. However, there are still very different ones within the EU countries Responses to these guidelines. In Austria, however, this directive was implemented in Section 96 (3) of the Telecommunications Act (TKG).

If you want to know more about cookies and don't shy away from technical documentation, we recommend https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6265 , the request for comments from the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) called "HTTP State Management Mechanism".
